channel.title: Nature Communications
channel.description:
Nature Communications is an open access, multidisciplinary journal dedicated to publishing high-quality research in all areas of the biological, health, physical, chemical and Earth sciences. Papers published by the journal aim to represent important advances of significance to specialists within each field.

We are committed to providing an efficient service for both authors and readers. Our team of independent editors make rapid and fair publication decisions. Prompt dissemination of accepted papers to a wide readership and beyond is achieved through a programme of continuous online publication.

item.title: Charge transfer governed interlayer magnetic coupling and symmetry breaking in a van der Waals magnet
item.content:encoded:
Nature Communications, Published online: 28 October 2025; doi:10.1038/s41467-025-64555-z

CrSBr is an air-stable van der Waals semiconducting layered antiferromagnet, holding the promise for a variety of spintronic applications. However, like all antiferromagnets, readout and control of the magnetic structures are challenging. Here, using a graphene gate on trilayer CrSBr, Hong, Sun, and coauthors succeed in full discrimination of otherwise degenerate magnetic states and electrical control of magnetic transitions.
item.dc:title: Charge transfer governed interlayer magnetic coupling and symmetry breaking in a van der Waals magnet
item.dc:creator: Canyu Hong
Zeyuan Sun
Zhiyuan Sheng
Shuang Wu
Yi Chen
Ming Tian
Neng Wan
Qixi Mi
Zhongkai Liu
Weibin Chu
Shiwei Wu

item.title: Theory of topological superconductivity and antiferromagnetic correlated insulators in twisted bilayer WSe<sub>2</sub>
item.content:encoded:
Nature Communications, Published online: 28 October 2025; doi:10.1038/s41467-025-64519-3

Recently, unconventional superconductivity was discovered in twisted-bilayer WSe2. Here, the authors’ theoretical analysis reveals that the ground state is a topological superconductor with Chern number C = ± 2 and dominant inter-valley pairing of $${d}_{xy}\pm i{d}_{{x}^{2}-{y}^{2}}$$ d x y ± i d x 2 − y 2 symmetry.
item.dc:title: Theory of topological superconductivity and antiferromagnetic correlated insulators in twisted bilayer WSe<sub>2</sub>
item.dc:creator: Chuyi Tuo
Ming-Rui Li
Zhengzhi Wu
Wen Sun
Hong Yao

item.title: Experimental realization of temporal refraction and reflection in elastic beams
item.content:encoded:
Nature Communications, Published online: 28 October 2025; doi:10.1038/s41467-025-64530-8

The authors experimentally demonstrate the refraction and reflection of flexural waves at a temporal boundary in an elastic beam with time-varying stiffness, achieved through piezoelectric patches and circuit-driven modulation. The findings validate the temporal Snell’s law and Fresnel equations, enabling precise control over wave amplitude and frequency.
item.dc:title: Experimental realization of temporal refraction and reflection in elastic beams
item.dc:creator: Shaoyun Wang
Nan Shao
Hui Chen
Jiaji Chen
Honghua Qian
Qian Wu
Huiling Duan
Andrea Alú
Guoliang Huang

item.title: Interfacial ferroelectricity unlocks stable formamidinium-based perovskites
item.content:encoded:
Nature Communications, Published online: 28 October 2025; doi:10.1038/s41467-025-64545-1

Achieving long-term phase-stabilized formamidinium (FA)-based perovskites remains challenging. Here, authors integrate ferroelectric CsMnBr3 nanocrystals into FA-based perovskites for ferroelectric field-mediated structural regulation, achieving maximum efficiency of 26.62% for stable solar cells.
item.dc:title: Interfacial ferroelectricity unlocks stable formamidinium-based perovskites
item.dc:creator: Yong Wang
Wenbin Han
Xingtao Wang
Biao Li
Yehui Wen
Tianchi Zhang
